column1: 1,"Here is the standard procedure for administering a flu vaccine:

column2: * Confirm patient identity and verify flu vaccine order.
* Review patient's medical history, anaphylaxis or allergic reactions to previous vaccinations,2009H1N1 or other substances).
* Ensure proper storage and handling of vaccines.
* Wash hands thoroughly with soap and water.
* Educate patients about the flu vaccine,benefits, risks, B contraindications).
* Obtain written informed consent or verbal agreement.
* Make sure dosage instructions match the prescription.
* Typically administer vaccines in the deltoid muscle (upper arm) region adultscircular rotation).
* Select the most accessible and least sensitive site depending on patient body compositioncircuits for optimal injection site placement.
* Remove caps/ covers from syringe s needles if using a preservative-free multi-dose vial.",semstamp_lsh,MaziyarPanahi/Meta-Llama-3-70B-Instruct-GPTQ
